medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initially presented with hyperthyroidism and a large goiter. Symptoms progressed to include neck pain and compressive symptoms over five months, leading to severe pain and a hardening of the goiter. Two months later, developed paresthesias, perioral numbness, and a seizure, indicating spontaneous primary hypoparathyroidism. Further complications included hoarseness and breathing difficulties due to massive thyroid enlargement and recurrent laryngeal nerve involvement.
